p: Giant viruses infecting amoeboids have also been detected and resurrected from frozen environments. Since their discovery in 1992, these viruses, able to infect protists and microalgae, have been isolated from diverse environments (La Scola et al. 2003; Aherfi et al. 2016). Noticeably, it is increasingly acknowledged that giant viruses could have an important impact on human health (Brandes and Linial 2019). For example, some works associate them with human diseases like adenitis, atopic pneumonia, and lymphoma, among others (Saadi et al. 2013a, b; Aherfi et al. 2016; Brandes and Linial 2019).
